text: Ox gall is gall, usually obtained from cows, that is mixed with alcohol and used as the wetting agent in paper marbling, engraving, lithography, and watercolor painting. It is a greenish-brown liquid mixture containing cholesterol, lecithin, taurocholic acid, and glycocholic acid. == References == == External links == * http://www.winsornewton.com/news/making-water-thick- or-thin-gum-arabic-and-ox-gall * http://www.neogen.com/acumedia/pdf/ProdInfo/7216_PI.pdf * http://www.usbio.net/item/O8175 Category:Animal glandular products Category:Surfactants
title: Ox gall
